When those limits were exceeded and the safe word was ignored, the user had the right to stop the session. The Domme's actions went beyond the agreed terms, which is a big red flag. The user's decision to not pay is justified because the service provided was dangerous and didn't adhere to the agreed terms. The Domme's reaction of threatening to report the user is more about protecting her own interests than addressing the safety breach.

So, in this case, the user isn't in the wrong. The Domme violated the agreed-upon safety protocols, and the user acted in self-preservation. The payment isn't required when the terms of the session were not followed. Therefore, the answer is B.
